properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 17 at 3:22PM CST until January 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Gale Warning, Southeast winds to 30 kt increasing
to gales to 40 kt by late evening, then veering to west gales to
40 kt Saturday morning and becoming northwest winds to 30 kt
early Sunday morning. Waves 8 to 12 feet expected. For the
Heavy Freezing Spray Watch, heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2
cm per hour or greater possible, and may rapidly accumulate on
vessels.

* WHERE...Southern Two Thirds of Lake Michigan, south of a line
from Sturgeon Bay to Point Betsie.

* WHEN...For the Gale Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 6 AM
CST Sunday. For the Heavy Freezing Spray Watch, from Saturday
afternoon through Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility. Operating a
vessel in heavy freezing spray is hazardous. Freezing spray may
render mechanical and electronic components inoperative. Ice
accretion on decks and superstructures may result in a
catastrophic loss of stability.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid or mitigate
hazardous accumulation of ice on their vessel.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST SUNDAY... ...HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
